channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump lawyers accuse former fixer Michael Cohen of lying to jury
item.description: Whether the defense is successful in undermining Cohen's testimony could determine Trump's fate in the case.

item.title: GameStop shares fall after it files to sell securities, says first quarter sales declined
Apple could owe you up to $349 in the iPhone 7 settlement. The deadline looms.
Sir Richard Branson—who hates being called a billionaire—sees net worth fall back to 2000 levels
item.description: Branson took a $126 million hit to his fortune last year as he continued to fight several fires at his Virgin Group.

item.title: 5 things to know before the stock market opens Friday
item.description: Here are the most important news items that investors need to start their trading day.

item.title: Reddit shares climb on ChatGPT deal with OpenAI
A deepfake ‘CFO’ tricked the British design firm behind the Sydney Opera House in $25 million fraud
item.description: “Our financial stability and business operations were not affected," an Arup spokesperson said.

item.title: Microsoft's Mistral partnership avoids merger probe by British regulators
item.description: The U.K.'s Competition and Markets Authority cleared Microsoft's AI partnership with Mistral of regulatory concerns after previously inviting views on whether the arrangement qualified as a merger.

item.title: 'On Watch' podcast: Tori Dunlap’s financial feminism and 401(k) changes
Taiwan is now exporting and investing more in the U.S. than China in major pivot away from Beijing
item.description: The U.S. displaced mainland China as the top destination for Taiwan’s exports in the first quarter of the year for the first time since the start of 2016, when comparable data became available.

item.title: The Dow tends to take a breather after surpassing big, round numbers
item.description: The Dow's rally to 40,000 could be followed by a pullback if historical performance is any guide.

item.title: Dow flirts with 40,000 -- so why aren't investors more excited?
Nearly half of Gen Z and millennial workers have left a job, or plan to, because of climate concerns
item.description: Instead of sitting with their climate change anxiety, Gen Z and millennials are trying to save the planet by quitting jobs that aren’t eco-friendly.

item.title: China pledges $42 billion in a slew of measures to support the struggling property sector
item.description: Chinese authorities on Friday pledged new support for state-owned enterprises to enable them to buy unsold apartments.

item.title: Applied Materials’ stock dips despite upbeat earnings
